content.description: <math alttext="f of x equals, the fraction the sine of x squared, over x, end fraction, for x not equal to 0; and f of x equals 0, for x equals 0." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace></mspace><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>
content.question: What are the first three nonzero terms of the Maclaurin series for the piecewise function defined as shown?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over x, end fraction, minus the fraction x cubed over 2 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the seventh power over 4 factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="x minus, the fraction x to the fifth power over 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the ninth power over 5 factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="x squared minus, the fraction x to the fourth power over 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the sixth power over 5 factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="x squared minus, the fraction x to the sixth power over 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the tenth power over 5 factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x minus, the fraction x to the fifth power over 3 factorial, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the ninth power over 5 factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

topic.text: 10.15: (BC ONLY) Representing Functions as Power Series

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
